paths: Patient with possible acute stroke -> Ensure the ABCs of airway, breathing, and (cardiopulmonary) circulation -> Obtain a focused history from the patient and/or eyewitness -> Perform a focused neurologic examination and complete the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) -> Perform an urgent noncontrast CT scan of the head -> Ischemic stroke

Patient with possible acute stroke -> Ensure the ABCs of airway, breathing, and (cardiopulmonary) circulation -> Obtain a focused history from the patient and/or eyewitness -> Perform a focused neurologic examination and complete the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) -> Perform an urgent noncontrast CT scan of the head -> Hemorrhage -> Intraparenchymal hemorrhage or CVT

Patient with possible acute stroke -> Ensure the ABCs of airway, breathing, and (cardiopulmonary) circulation -> Obtain a focused history from the patient and/or eyewitness -> Perform a focused neurologic examination and complete the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) -> Perform an urgent noncontrast CT scan of the head -> Hemorrhage -> Subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)
